page.title: 04Education
page.content: Being a thinly populated area with few children, education poses problems for local authorities.{Aby}school has places for 100 childred - 36 at present attending. Buses bring pupils from other local villages. The school is Church of England controlled, catering for children{4-1/2 to 11 years, taught by the Headmistress and 1 full-time teacher. An examination (11+) decides whether children go on to a{grammar or secondary modern school in Alford or Louth, to which transport is provided. For working youth day-release is available at {Louth or Riseholme Agricultural {College.}Due to falling birth rates the structure of education is being examined with a view to reorganisation.
